collection: A privacy policy, by default, is a contract users agree to BECAUSE personal information is being stored.

Websites are more often employing "[tracking pixels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_beacon "wikipedia:Web beacon")" from companies such as Facebook and Twitter, which is an image file that is hosted on an external server that allows cross-platform and cross-session tracking for targeted advertisements.
| Privacy policies normally deal with electronic cookies that track user activity and store personal information.
